citation.article-title: Silicibacter lacuscaerulensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a mesophilic moderately halophilic bacterium characteristic of the Blue Lagoon geothermal lake in Iceland.

p.s: Description of Silicibacter lacuscaerulensis sp. nov.
Silicibacter lacuscaerulensis (la.cus.cae.rul.len'sis. L. masc. n. lacus, lake; L. adj. caeruleus, blue; M.L. adj. lacuscaerulensis, pertaining to the blue lake)
Membrane-bound cytochrome c with a distinctive peak at 549nm.
The GC content of type strain ITI-1157 is 66.15 mol%.
Optimal growth at 45Â°C and pH 7.5 and about 3.5% (w/v) NaCl.
Growth occurs at up to 7% (w/v) NaCl.
Type strain: Silicibacter lacuscaerulensis ITI-1157 (isolated from Blue Lagoon, near Svartsengi geothermal powerplant, Iceland).
